title: Jess Cartner-Morley’s April style essentials: from sexy spring sweaters to the loafers that won the high street
description: It’s time for a reset! Our fashion guru reveals how you can shake up your wardrobe for the new season• The best Chanel-style jackets to rival the real thingIn the winter months, I crave the comfort of repetition. I want to make a vat of soup to keep in the fridge and have a bowl for lunch every day. I long to discover a TV drama that I have somehow missed and have seasons to catch up on so that I can watch an episode every night. Hibernation, essentially.Then, after months of that, the clocks go forward and – like clockwork – I get an itch for novelty. Yesterday I went to refresh the water in a vase of flowers on the mantelpiece; 15 minutes later all the stems were piled up around me on the floor and I was curating a whole new arrangement. Change is good! In the mood to shake something up? Out with the old. In with the newness! Read on for some hot-off-the-press thoughts. Continue reading...
author: Jess Cartner-Morley

title: Bad taste? Balenciaga coffee cup bag is luxury fashion’s latest everyday flaunt
description: £4,350 calfskin clutch is part of a trend for the wealthy ‘to engage with mass consumption while retaining exclusivity’Lauren Sánchez attended a meeting in LA recently carrying a cup of coffee. So far, so unnewsworthy. But what first appeared as her morning caffeine fix was, in fact, a luxury handbag. The Balenciaga design, which is crafted from calfskin, sells for about £4,346.60 more than the average takeaway coffee in the UK.It mimics the reusable Balenciaga coffee cup – made of porcelain and polypropylene, it sells for £85 – and throwaway vessels. Continue reading...
author: Ellie Violet Bramley

title: Everlane’s Spring Arrivals Blend The Fisherman Aesthetic With ‘90s Nostalgia
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Welcome to New Arrivals, where R29 editors test out the latest pieces from their favorite brands and share their top looks. Whether you’re overwhelmed by the number of places to shop or trying to hone in your personal style, come along as we explore ‘fits, fabrics, styling potential, and more by sorting through the virtual and IRL shelves at our go-to shopping destinations.  If you’re looking to mix nostalgic ‘90s style while diving into the trendy fisherman aesthetic, you’re in luck! Everlane’s new arrivals — and more specifically, its 90s Forever Edit — are packed with wardrobe staples that are both on-trend and timeless. After trying on several pieces myself, I can confidently say the designs are versatile, and the quality is worth the investment. (I now own the Merino wool cardigan and the darted mini dress below). Plus, Everlane is transparent about its sustainability initiatives and organic materials, so you can add styles to your closet with clarity, knowing they’re built to last and kind to the environment. While I’d previously only tried Everlane’s barrel-leg jeans, my longtime admiration for the brand — and the feedback from Refinery29 readers who swear by it — compelled me to put more styles to the test. (Truly, as much as readers look to R29 for shopping suggestions, I love to flip the script by diving deeper into the brands that resonate most.) Spoiler alert: You all love Everlane, and I see why. From wide-leg jeans and jorts to blazers, trench coats, ballet flats, and boat shoes galore, Everlane’s new offerings are perfect for building office-approved “uniforms,” casual off-duty outfits, and spring party looks.Read on to check out some of my favorite pieces and see how I styled them for various warm-weather occasions to spark your own spring outfit ideas. DashDividers_1_500x100 Everlane New Arrivals: Spring-Ready Wardrobe Staples If these sunny Mary Jane ballet flats immediately put a smile on your face, same! And yes, the leather is as buttery yellow as the color suggests. I styled them with denim and many of my go-to tops for casual looks that I’ll definitely be recreating all season long. While the striped T-shirt (hello, nautical vibes) and jorts (totally Rachel Green-approved) are great for weekend plans, I’d pair the dark-wash jeans with these flats for the office or a dinner outing. DashDividers_1_500x100 Everlane New Arrivals: Red-Hot Party & Workwear The ‘90s edit features several pops of red, and I’m here for it. Although the hue isn’t one you immediately associate with spring, it’s as vibrant and fresh as a batch of cherries — sa-weet! For work, try the red square-neck bodysuit under tailored suiting separates, and for nights out, opt for the dress version to serve ‘90s supermodel vibes. (Both pieces are super-stretchy and breathable — bonus points!) You can even experiment with tonal red shoes, like Everlane’s signature Day Glove flat. DashDividers_1_500x100 Everlane New Arrivals: Fisherman Aesthetic-Approved If there was ever a time to take the TikTok-viral fisherman aesthetic for a spin, this was it. From the khaki anorak and trench coat to the blue-and-white pinstripe tops, I put together two outfits that are both seaside-ready and city-appropriate. I loved the anorak from one look (a hero piece for transitional weather) and the baggy jeans from the other (so cool and casual), but Everlane’s new boat shoes really up-leveled these looks. I have to admit, the nautical-meets-preppy vibes have officially grown on me. DashDividers_1_500x100 Everlane New Arrivals: Preppy Warm-Weather Vibes Even when I ventured out of my comfort zone with a preppy look, it turned out adorable and sweet — I kind of felt like Sandy from Grease, from the retro white-and-yellow palette to the cutesy cardigan — very Hopelessly Devoted to You nightgown vibes but for day. I draped the brand’s cardigan over my shoulders (a popular NYFW styling trend) atop the linen A-line dress (which is forgiving with a bit of stretch, making it a favorite). And the mini bucket bag? Perfect as a crossbody when you’re feeling it. DashDividers_1_500x100 I didn’t get a chance to try on the collection’s once-divisive capris, but you can still shop them below, along with other new arrivals worth adding to your spring wardrobe. Shop all Everlane Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?How To Style The Bloomer Pants Trend For SpringBoat Shoes Are The Spring 2025 “Ugly” Shoe TrendCropped Trench Coats That Put A Twist On A Classic
author: Victoria Montalti

title: Jenny Bird’s 48-Hour Sale Features Editor-Approved Best-sellers
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. A little jewel-adorned birdy told us something big is coming, so we’re breaking the good news! Celebrity-approved modern jewelry brand Jenny Bird (the little birdy in question) is holding its always anticipated 48-hour sale. That’s right, starting 7 p.m. EST on April 3, the *entire* Jenny Bird site (with a few exceptions) will be on sale. Many of Jenny Bird’s statement silver and gold earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and more will be discounted at 25% off during the two-day sale. (Just note that all purchases are final sale!)   Whether you’re looking for gold-plated chunky earrings or chain-link anklets (Refinery29 editor favorites) or zodiac sign necklaces, you’ll likely be able to find them on sale for 48 sweet hours. Keep an eye out for exclusive pieces and special deals, too: For example, you could get a free ear cuff set when you spend more than $225. So get browsing and consider carting up luxe pieces for yourself — or maybe for upcoming gifting needs for loved ones (*cough cough* Mother’s Day) — while they’re heavily discounted. DashDividers_1_500x100 Jenny Bird Earrings On Sale While the majority of the deals during Jenny Bird’s 48-hour sale are 25% off, a few select pieces are 30% off — including some of the brand’s most covetable earring styles. Regardless of the level of discount, now’s your chance to scoop some of the label’s popular hoops and puffy silhouettes. DashDividers_1_500x100 Jenny Bird Rings On Sale Whether you prefer a more low-key style for everyday wear or are more drawn to eye-catching pieces that are sure to earn a wave of compliments, there’s a discounted Jenny Bird ring for you.  DashDividers_1_500x100 Jenny Bird Bracelets On Sale From bold cuffs and chunky bangles to delicate chain bracelets, you can find it all on sale. Plus, you can start a brand-new stack and get an extra 10% off when you buy two or more bracelets. Jenny Bird Necklaces On Sale During this two-day sale, take your pick from the brand’s best-selling zodiac and monogram pendant necklaces for a touch of personalization, opt for something more classic with chain and pearl-adorned styles, or make a fun style statement with pieces boasting shells, charms, glass beads. Jenny Bird Anklets On Sale Jenny Bird has long been in on the return of the anklet, and with warm weather fast approaching, could there be a better time to try one out for yourself? Shop the full Jenny Bird 48-Hour Sale from April 3-5 Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?The 7 Biggest Jewelry Trends For 2025This Weekend's Best Sales, According To Us10 Trendy Tarnish-Free Gold Jewelry Brands
author: Victoria Montalti

title: 30 Best Women’s Sneakers, According to Celebrities and Editors
description: Being comfortable in your own shoes never goes out of style, so investing in a top-tier sneaker collection is always a smart idea. When it comes to picking out the best sneakers, we look for a few key elements: good sneaker design, quality materials, and the perfect fit - because who wants to be uncomfortable? Our editors test out so many different types of shoes to provide you with the best product recommendations, and we boast a particular expertise on sneakers (call us sneakerheads, if you will). Love some casual, everyday sneakers? We've got you covered. Prefer sportier, performance sneakers for working out? We found those, too. And of course, if you're looking for cute sneakers that you can dress up for work, we've tried our fair share. To help you find the best women's sneakers to add to your wardrobe, we enlisted our expert editors, along with a handful of celebrities we've interviewed - like Kate Hudson, Ashley Graham, and Ayesha Curry - for their masterful recommendations of the best women's sneakers for 2025. These picks cover a range of styles, so you're bound to find your perfect shoe. What to Look For in the Best Women's Sneakers Whether you want something modern and playful or sleek and classic, we've uncovered the best of the best trending this year, and we'll tell you all the reasons we love these stylish sneakers. The styles fall into a number of different design categories, including: best trendy sneakers, best sustainable sneakers, best athletic sneakers, best high-top sneakers, best white sneakers, best classic sneakers, and best sneakers for walking. At the moment, fashion forecasters predict sporty dad sneakers will continue to be big throughout 2025 - particularly styles from brands like New Balance and Adidas. In an homage to the '90s and early aughts, chunky platform sneakers are also being embraced by stylists and celebrities alike - as showcased via New York Fashion Week street style. And the newly debuted Reebok Classic AZ Shoes are primed to be the hottest everyday sneaker this year, thanks to its neutral palette that's easy to style with a range of outfits. Our own sneaker recommendations tout brands like Nike, Converse, Puma, and more. Word of advice: your shoe closet is about to get a whole lot fuller, so make some extra room. Keep reading to shop our guide to the best sneakers for women.
author: Kyley Warren

title: 13 Wedding Guest Dresses You'll Want to Wear on Repeat, Including Sydney Sweeney's
description: It's no secret that getting a gorgeous letter-pressed wedding invitation in the mail brings immediate excitement. Your eyes quickly scan the location and before you know it, you're on Pinterest gathering a mood board or scrolling through Farfetch to find that standout ensemble that'll earn you the title of best-dressed for the night. As exhilarating as the search for the perfect wedding guest dress can be, it can easily get stressful when there's a dress code involved. We have nothing against them, but a dress code has the power to make your shopping escapade a breeze or a headache - especially when they're unofficial. Wedding attire has become unconventional in recent years, but apparently, stern rules still apply if you're Sydney Sweeney. The "Anyone But You" star recently caused a stir for wearing a blue corset dress (that's close to white) to co-star Glen Powell's sister's wedding. The viral outfit has left the internet divided on what's acceptable wedding attire versus what isn't. But let's be real, you can wear anything you want to a wedding. We've seen everything from TikTok trends done right like the stomach pudge dress to guests dressed in all-white that's totally cosigned by the bride herself (just like Solange Knowles's iconic ceremony). Surely, a blue dress is more than acceptable, too. Whether you're attending an upcoming wine-country wedding that's sure to be warm or an indoor ceremony with a cocktail party dress code (that's not super strict), we found a handful of wedding guest dresses that are bound to catch your eye. From florals for spring to formal pieces that are equal parts boundary-pushing and stylish, we've gathered our top picks that you'll want to wear on repeat. Now all that's left is to pick out something from the registry and get it wrapped in time - easy peasy. Shop our top wedding guest dresses ahead.
author: Haley Lyndes
